INFO.description: Welcome to the easy colors game. First, you will learn each color (red, green, and blue), then you will conquer the brain blaster!
INFO.objective: Be able to identify the Filipino words for each color taught and know the Filipino words for common objects of those colors.
instructions: Navigate through each of the given colors and review the examples given.
When up for the task, you will face the brain blaster.

prep.introConcept: In Filipino, the word for 'color' is 'kulay.'
prep.exampleUsage: To say that something is a color, use 'ay kulay' followed by the color. For example, 'Ang mansanas ay kulay pula.' (The apple is red.)
prep.gameTip: Remember, colors often appear in everyday objects! Think of common items like fruits (mga prutas) or plants (mga halaman) to help remember.

TEXT.helperText: Pula means 'red' in Filipino. It's used the same way as 'red' in English, like describing a red apple (mansanas na pula) or a red car (kotse na pula).
Berde sounds a bit like 'verdant,' which means green and lush in English. Think of green grass (damo) or trees (mga puno).
Asul means 'blue' in Filipino, similar to the color of the sky (langit) or the ocean (karagatan).

QUESTIONS.question: What is the Filipino word for red?
Which color does 'berde' represent?
What is the Filipino word for blue?
Ang langit ay kulay asul.
Ang mansanas ay kulay asul.
The word for 'sky' in Filipino is 'langit'.

INFO.objective: Be able to identify the Spanish words for each color taught and know the Spanish words for common objects of those colors.
instructions: Navigate through each of the given colors and review the examples given.
When up for the task, you will face the brain blaster.

prep.introConcept: In Spanish, the word for 'color' is 'color.'
prep.exampleUsage: To say that something is a color, use 'es color' followed by the color. For example, 'La manzana es color roja.' (The apple is red.)
prep.gameTip: Remember, colors often appear in everyday objects! Think of common items like fruits or plants to help you remember.

TEXT.helperText: Rojo means 'red' in Spanish. It's used the same way as 'red' in English, like describing a red apple (manzana roja) or a red car (coche rojo).
Verde is similar to 'verdant,' which means green and lush in English. Think of green grass or trees.
Azul means 'blue' in Spanish, similar to the color of the sky or the ocean.

QUESTIONS.question: What is the Spanish word for red?
Which color does 'verde' represent?
If 'azul' means blue, what color is the sky in Spanish?

INFO.objective: Be able to identify the Portuguese words for each color taught and know the Portuguese words for common objects of those colors.
instructions: Navigate through each of the given colors and review the examples given.
When ready, you will take on the brain blaster.

prep.introConcept: In Portuguese, the word for 'color' is 'cor.'
prep.exampleUsage: To say that something is a color, use 'é da cor' followed by the color. For example, 'A maçã é da cor vermelha.' (The apple is red.)
prep.gameTip: Colors often appear in everyday objects! Think of common items like fruits (frutas) or plants (plantas) to help you remember.

TEXT.linkedText: A maçã é da cor vermelha.
TEXT.helperText: Vermelho means 'red' in Portuguese. It describes things like a red apple (maçã vermelha) or a red car (carro vermelho).

TEXT.linkedText: A grama é da cor verde.
TEXT.helperText: Verde means 'green' in Portuguese, used for grass (grama) or trees (árvores).

TEXT.linkedText: O céu é da cor azul.
TEXT.helperText: Azul means 'blue' in Portuguese, similar to the color of the sky (céu) or the ocean (oceano).

QUESTIONS.question: What is the Portuguese word for red?
Which color does 'verde' represent?
What is the Portuguese word for blue?
O céu é da cor azul.
A maçã é da cor azul.
The word for 'sky' in Portuguese is 'céu.'
